nodes.title: Genomic Instability in Human Lymphocytes Exposed to Simulated Galactic Cosmic Rays
nodes.summary: This study investigates the long-term effects of simulated GCR exposure on DNA double-strand breaks and chromosomal aberrations in human peripheral blood lymphocytes, aiming to quantify risks for deep-space missions.

nodes.title: Novel Resistive Exercise Protocols to Mitigate Bone Loss in Microgravity
nodes.summary: Evaluation of a high-intensity, low-volume resistive exercise regimen as a countermeasure against spaceflight-induced osteopenia in a rodent model.

nodes.title: The Role of Auxin Transport in Arabidopsis Thaliana Root Skewing Under Simulated Microgravity
nodes.summary: Investigating the molecular pathways governing root growth directionality by analyzing auxin transporter gene expression in Arabidopsis seedlings on the International Space Station.

nodes.title: Characterization of Fungal Communities on ISS Interior Surfaces
nodes.summary: A metagenomic analysis of fungal species isolated from various locations within the ISS, assessing potential risks to crew health and hardware integrity.

nodes.title: Cognitive Performance and Neuroplasticity During Long-Duration Spaceflight
nodes.summary: Utilizing fMRI and behavioral assessments to track changes in brain structure and function, particularly in areas related to spatial navigation and executive function, in astronauts aboard the ISS.

nodes.title: Muscle Atrophy Mechanisms in Drosophila melanogaster During Spaceflight
nodes.summary: Gene expression analysis of flight muscles in fruit flies flown on the ISS to identify key signaling pathways involved in microgravity-induced muscle degradation.

nodes.title: Development of a Closed-Loop Algae-Based Bioregenerative Life Support System
nodes.summary: Designing and testing a photobioreactor for efficient oxygen production, carbon dioxide removal, and water purification using Chlorella vulgaris for future deep-space habitats.

nodes.title: Fluid Shifts and Ocular Health: Investigating Spaceflight-Associated Neuro-ocular Syndrome (SANS)
nodes.summary: An examination of the cephalad fluid shift's impact on intraocular pressure, optic nerve sheath diameter, and retinal morphology in astronauts.

nodes.title: Survival and Metabolic Activity of Tardigrades Exposed to Mars-like UV Radiation and Atmospheric Conditions
nodes.summary: This experiment tests the resilience of various tardigrade species in a simulated Martian environment, assessing their potential as indicators for extraterrestrial habitability.

nodes.title: Lignin and Cellulose Deposition in Wheat Stems Grown in Microgravity
nodes.summary: Quantifying changes in cell wall composition and structural integrity of Triticum aestivum grown on the ISS to understand the impact of gravity on plant biomechanics.

nodes.title: Pharmacological Intervention to Mitigate Radiation-Induced Oxidative Stress
nodes.summary: Pre-clinical trial of a novel antioxidant cocktail designed to protect cellular structures from damage caused by space radiation exposure.

nodes.title: Immune System Dysregulation in Mice After a 30-Day Spaceflight Mission
nodes.summary: Analysis of T-cell activation and cytokine profiles in splenic tissues from mice housed in the Rodent Research Habitat on the ISS.

nodes.title: Enhanced Biofilm Formation by Pseudomonas aeruginosa in Simulated Microgravity
nodes.summary: Investigating the structural and genetic changes in P. aeruginosa biofilms grown under low-shear modeled microgravity conditions, focusing on antibiotic resistance.

nodes.title: Insulin Resistance and Glucose Metabolism in Astronauts Post-Flight
nodes.summary: A longitudinal study tracking markers of insulin resistance and changes in metabolic hormones in crew members before, during, and after long-duration missions.

nodes.title: Machine Learning Models for Predicting Space Radiation Health Risks
nodes.summary: Development of a predictive algorithm using integrated omics data and flight telemetry to provide personalized health risk assessments for astronauts.

nodes.title: Vestibular System Development in Zebrafish (Danio rerio) in Microgravity
nodes.summary: Observing the formation and function of otoliths in zebrafish larvae developing in space to understand gravity's role in vestibular sensory organ maturation.

nodes.title: Chlorophyll Fluorescence and Photosynthetic Efficiency of Dwarf Tomatoes in the VEGGIE Growth Chamber
nodes.summary: Monitoring the photosynthetic performance and biomass production of Solanum lycopersicum grown on the ISS under different light spectra.

nodes.title: Latent Virus Reactivation in Astronauts During Long-Duration Missions
nodes.summary: Analysis of saliva and blood samples for the reactivation of latent herpesviruses, such as Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) and Varicella-zoster virus (VZV), as a marker of immune system suppression.

nodes.title: Validation of Ambient Temperature RNA Stabilization Techniques for Spaceflight
nodes.summary: Comparing the efficacy of novel chemical preservatives for maintaining RNA integrity in biological samples collected on the ISS without the need for cold stowage.

nodes.title: Gene Expression Changes in Salmonella Typhimurium in Response to Spaceflight
nodes.summary: Transcriptomic analysis of Salmonella grown in orbit to identify virulence-associated genes that are differentially regulated by microgravity and space radiation.

nodes.title: Mammalian Fertilization and Early Embryonic Development in Microgravity
nodes.summary: An investigation using mouse gametes to determine the success rates of in-vitro fertilization and subsequent blastocyst formation in a spaceflight environment.

nodes.title: Heat Shock Protein Expression in Leaf Tissues of Mizuna Greens on the ISS
nodes.summary: Examining the cellular stress response in Brassica rapa var. nipposinica by quantifying heat shock protein levels after exposure to the combined stressors of spaceflight.

nodes.title: Synergistic Effects of Microgravity and Radiation on Endothelial Cell Function
nodes.summary: An in-vitro study on human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) to model the combined impact of spaceflight stressors on vascular health and cardiovascular disease risk.

nodes.title: A Comparative Study of Cardiac Deconditioning in Humans and Rodent Models in Space
nodes.summary: Analyzing cardiac tissue and non-invasive human physiological data to compare the molecular and functional changes in the heart during spaceflight across different species.

nodes.title: Nitrogen Uptake and Assimilation in Rice Roots Under Microgravity Conditions
nodes.summary: Tracing the movement and metabolism of isotope-labeled nitrogen in Oryza sativa to understand how nutrient transport is altered in the absence of gravity-driven convection.
